Classes.Name: Honors Algebra II
Classes.Description: Like Algebra I, but harder.

Classes.Name: Honors Biology
Classes.Description: This was a very difficult class that rivals some of my computer science and math classes taken at Purdue. Unfortunately I did not like it very much and decided that I did not want to be a doctor or biology major.

Classes.Name: Honors Computer Programming I
Classes.Description: My first foray into the dark and terrifying realm of Python programming.

Classes.Name: Concert Band
Classes.Description: My last year playing the trumpet in a band. I enjoyed it.

Classes.Name: Intro to Engineering and Design
Classes.Description: First year PLTW Engineering course.

Classes.Name: Honors English I
Classes.Description: English

Classes.Name: Spanish I
Classes.Description: Spanish

Classes.Name: Honors Spanish II
Classes.Description: Spanish but harder

Classes.Name: Honors Computer Integrated Manufacturing
Classes.Description: Second year PLTW Engineering course which shockingly focuses on computers and manufacturing.

Classes.Name: Honors US History I
Classes.Description: US History to the Reconstruction Era

Classes.Name: Honors Precalculus
Classes.Description: A class with a scary reputation that was not actually that hard.

Classes.Name: Honors Chemistry
Classes.Description: Basic chemistry

Classes.Name: English II
Classes.Description: English but harder

Classes.Name: AP Computer Science
Classes.Description: Java programming and the class that made me want to be a computer science major.

Classes.Name: AP Chemistry
Classes.Description: Chemistry but harder

Classes.Name: AP Physics I
Classes.Description: No calculus

Classes.Name: AP Calculus AB
Classes.Description: A very interesting class and the one that made me want to be a math major.

Classes.Name: AP Language and Composition
Classes.Description: Harder English but harder.

Classes.Name: AP US History
Classes.Description: The final boss of AP Exams

Classes.Name: Principles of Engineering
Classes.Description: Engineering with physics

Classes.Name: Spanish III
Classes.Description: Harder Spanish but harder

Classes.Name: AP Physics C
Classes.Description: Mechanics and electricity in one

Classes.Name: English IV
Classes.Description: Harder harder English but harder

Classes.Name: Engineering Design and Development
Classes.Description: Yearlong capstone project where a partner and I developed a water-quality monitoring system

Classes.Name: AP World History: Modern
Classes.Description: Modern world history starting with the fall of the Roman Empire.

Classes.Name: Spanish IV
Classes.Description: Harder harder Spanish but harder

Classes.Name: AP Economics
Classes.Description: Macroeconomics and microeconomics in one class. A very interesting class that has made me consider an economics minor in college.

Classes.Name: AP Calculus BC
Classes.Description: Potentially my favorite class I took in high school and what made me seriously consider double majoring in math.

Classes.Name: Problem Solving and Object-Oriented Programming
Classes.Description: Introduction to programming in Java for computer science majors. Control flow, objects, classes, interfaces, inheritance, GUI programming, concurrency, basic data structures.

Classes.Name: Multivariate Calculus
Classes.Description: Multivariable calculus. Vectors, partial differentiation, double and triple integrals, various theorems.

Classes.Name: Spanish III
Classes.Description: Third semester Spanish. Everything from the difference between ser and estar to the subjunctive mood.

Classes.Name: Tools
Classes.Description: Seminar class covering basic skills that computer science majors need to know. Configuring and using Vim, using ssh, terminal commands, compiling C files, debugging C programs.

Classes.Name: The Data Mine
Classes.Description: Seminar on data analysis with R.

Classes.Name: Foundations of Computer Science
Classes.Description: Discrete mathematics. Logic, discrete structures, algorithms, number theory, induction, recursion, counting, graphs, trees, boolean algebra.

Classes.Name: C Programming
Classes.Description: Compiling, linking, debugging, structures, binary and plaintext file I/O, pointers, memory management, linked lists, trees, recursion, networking, hardware.

Classes.Name: Elementary Linear Algebra
Classes.Description: Matrices, Gaussian elimination, vector spaces, linear transformations, determinants, eigenvectors, diagonalization.

Classes.Name: Introduction to Construction
Classes.Description: Introduction to construction terminology and management concepts.

Classes.Name: The Data Mine
Classes.Description: Seminar on data analysis with Python.
